curam.util.resources

Class SimpleHttpClientUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.resources.SimpleHttpClientUtils

  • public class SimpleHttpClientUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Some utilities for manually sending and receiving HTTP requests and responses.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SimpleHttpClientUtils.HeaderEntry
      Represents a HTML request header entry.

        socket - The socket to the host server.
        hostEncoding - Specifies the encoding of the host server.
        enableTracing - Enables tracing mode.

    • Method Detail

      • sendToSocket

        public void sendToSocket(java.util.List<java.lang.String> stringList)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a list of strings to a socket, delimited by new line characters.
        Parameters:
        stringList - A list of strings to send.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the write fails.

      • readFromSocket

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> readFromSocket()
                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Does a HTTP style read from a socket, applying some HTTP directives such as content size and chunked transfer.
        Returns:
        A list of strings received from the server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the read fails.

      • getHeaderNameAndValue

        public static SimpleHttpClientUtils.HeaderEntry getHeaderNameAndValue(java.lang.String htmlLine)
        Parses a (potential) HTML header entry into its name and value.
        Parameters:
        htmlLine - A line of text which may represent a HTTP header.
        Returns:
        An entry representing the name and value of the header - if we determined it actually is a header, otherwise null.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes our socket.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If we failed to close it.

      • getCookies

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCookies(java.util.List<java.lang.String> headerList)
        Gets the cookies which were set in the list of HTTP response headers.
        Parameters:
        headerList - A list of strings returned from a HTTP server, some of which may be HTTP header responses.
        Returns:
        A list of any cookie values which were specified.

      • rebuildCookiesHeader

        public java.lang.String rebuildCookiesHeader(java.util.List<java.lang.String> cookiesList)
        Constructs a single Cookie header from the list of cookies received from the server.
        Parameters:
        cookiesList - The list of cookie headers received from the server.
        Returns:
        A string representing the cookies in the given list if any, or an empty string if none were recognised.
